edu.wit.general.rosenbergd.examples

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wit.general.rosenbergd.examples.Time

  • public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    Consider a class Time that represents a time of day. It has attributes for the hour and minute. The hour value ranges from 0 to 23, where the range 0 to 11 represents a time before noon. The minute value ranges from 0 to 59. Use the provided Time.java as a starting point – do not change the unit tests (main() and the private utility methods following main()).
    Author:
    David M Rosenberg

    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time()
        Creates and initializes a Time object to 12:00 midnight

      • Time

        public Time(int initialHours,
            int initialMinutes)
        Creates and initializes a Time object given the time in 24-hour format
        Parameters:
        initialHours - 24-hour format in the range 0..23
        initialMinutes - minutes in the range 0..59

        postconditions: if the specified hours and minutes are in-range, the object will reflect those value but the time will be set to 0 hours and 0 minutes (12:00 midnight) if either or both values are out-of-range

      • Time

        public Time(int initialHours,
            int initialMinutes,
            boolean isAM)
        Creates and initializes a Time object given the time in 12-hour format
        Parameters:
        initialHours - whole number in the range 1..12 inclusive
        initialMinutes - whole number in the range 0..59 inclusive
        isAM - true: AM; false: PM

        postconditions: if the specified hours and minutes are in-range, the object will reflect those value but the time will be set to 0 hours and 0 minutes (12:00 midnight) if either or both values are out-of-range

    • Method Detail

      • getTime12

        public java.lang.String getTime12()
        Formats the current Time in 12-hour format
        Returns:
        [h]h:mm {am | pm}

      • getTime24

        public java.lang.String getTime24()
        Formats the current Time in 24-hour format
        Returns:
        hhmm where hours and minutes are always 2-digits each with leading 0-fill if needed

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int newHours,
                    int newMinutes)
        Set the current time given the time in 24-hour format
        Parameters:
        newHours - 24-hour format in the range 0..23
        newMinutes - minutes in the range 0..59

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int newHours,
                    int newMinutes,
                    boolean isAM)
        Set the current time given the time in 12-hour format
        Parameters:
        newHours - 12-hour format in the range 1..12
        newMinutes - minutes in the range 0..59
        isAM - true: AM; false: PM
